result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael Paul Maxwell appeared by video.  Attorney Marcus Hirsch appeared by video for Michael Paul Maxwell.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel ha offer and discovery and requests.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case heard off the record.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Paul Maxwell appeared by video.  Attorney Marcus Hirsch appeared by video for Michael Paul Maxwell.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel motion to strike the domestic abuse assessment modifier argued and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel still needs discovery on this case and requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.

Defendant Michael Paul Maxwell in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case to allow defendant to retain private counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 2/23/22
Per state's motion, victim is requesting modification of no contact order. Court holds colloquy with victim. Court hears argument.  For reasons as set forth, Court DENIES state's motion.

Defendant Michael Paul Maxwell in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case to allow defendant to retain private counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the cash bail be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E.B.M. (dob 1/28/1988).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Paul Maxwell in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
